column4: chaosafs: First things first. How did you install Ubuntu? Using the LiveCD or the alternate install CD?
i believe i downloaded the live CD and burned it to a CD
pretty sure
I really do not know or think so.
the iso is named something like this
ubuntu-6.06.1-desktop-i386
Have you got the name of the motherboard?
chaosafs: and you're not able to get it to show you a graphical interface?
chaosafs: Which graphics card/chipset have you got?
radeon 9250 PCI card
so whats with the DOS?
i typed startx and all i got was "no screens found"
chaosafs: There seems to be an issue with that graphics card. Have you tried choosing VGA safe mode in the boot menu?
chaosafs: I think it should be the F4 key to choose it.
chaosafs: Hopefully that will give you the x screen.
chaosafs: However that screen will be very low resolution (800x600 or something) and some windows in the installer are too big for that.
chaosafs: to move them around simply hold your ALT key and click and drag the window to move it.
chaosafs: When you've got ubuntu installed you will be able to install the fglrx drivers for your card and you should be able to use normal resolutions.
chaosafs: also if you've got an integrated graphics card in your motherboard it might (but really should not) help to turn it off in the BIOS.
chaosafs: any questions?
chaosafs: and what you've got is not DOS but a TTY terminal server.
so... what do i type in the black screen :P
